basic.description: Intermediate probability theory as a basis for further study in mathematical statistics and stochastic processes; probability measures, expectations; modes of convergence of sequences of random variables; conditional expectations; independent systems of random variables; Gaussian systems; characteristic functions; Law of large numbers, Central limit theory; some notions of dependence.
basic.subject: STAT
basic.title: Probability II

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites     (STAT268 or STAT351) and (MATH110 or MATH111 or MATH112) and MATH281.
